mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Lund Washington, 1775 November 26
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This is a directive to his managers on subjects of responsibility during his absence -- wages, hospitality to be shown, and precautions to be taken against attacks from the river -- would sell rum in the barn and wine put in a secure place -- "Let the Hospitality of the House with respect to the Poor, be kept up; Let no one go hungry away ..." Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, incomplete, integral cover docketed by Washington from Cambridge, Nov. 27, laminated, (not examined for watermark). Name on original manuscript appears as "G. Washington".
